item.description: Uncle Ramesh offering rewards fuh solving de nation's greatest mysteries. Terms and Whose Friend Yuh Is may apply.

item.title: ðŸ“¸ Back-a-Truck: Wha We Spot Dis Week
item.description: Absurd tings spotted around Guyana dis week. You can't make dis up!

item.title: Friday's Guyana Brief - Oil Wells Racing to Empty, Speaker Races to India
item.description:
Good morning, Guyana! â˜•

Welcome to Friday, where our oil fields are being liquidated faster than a closing-down sale, our Speaker fled to India while Parliament remains closed, and Exxon’s 75% “expense deduction” makes Nigerian email scams look amateur.

Today’s menu: The Great Oil Heist exposed (75% goes to “costs”), Speaker escapes to India during constitutional crisis, French Ambassador politely suggests democracy might be nice, Mashramani launches because at least we can party, and President Ali promises no Venezuela deals (this time he means it, promise).

item.title: Daily Laugh: De Report-A-Hole Disaster
item.description: Government launches pothole app. Uncle Ramesh becomes their #1 user. Chaos ensues. Yellow paint involved.

item.title: ðŸ˜Š [PRO-GOV] Uncle Ramesh: When De Government Does De Math Right (For Once)
item.description: Uncle Ramesh does the math on the census data and discovers the government was actually planning ahead. Who knew? Plus, finally some people heading to jail.

item.title: Tuesday's Guyana Brief: Apps, Laws, and Courtroom Drama
item.description: Attorney General scolds magistrates for ignoring laws, government promises 87 new apps, and President Ali discovers swamps can become highways (who knew?). Welcome to Tuesday in paradise!

item.title: ðŸ˜Š [PRO-GOV] Uncle Ramesh: When De Numbers Tell De REAL Story
item.description: Uncle Ramesh explains why 25% crime reduction is actually amazing, and why spending $123M on safety makes sense. Progress is progress!

item.title: Monday's Guyana Brief: The Week Starts With a Yelling
item.description:
Good morning, Guyana! â˜•

Welcome to Monday, where last week’s problems are this week’s problems with a fresh coat of optimistic denial.

Nothing got fixed over the weekend. Shocked? You shouldn’t be.

Today’s menu: GuySuCo gets scolded (again), The Mohameds perfect the art of not leaving, crime stats achieve Olympic-level creativity, and we learn why complaining about bribery is somehow worse than actual bribery. Just another week in paradise!

ðŸ“Š TODAY’S NUMBERS

Mohamed Appeals: 47 (their lawyer’s yacht fund thanks you)

item.title: Uncle Ramesh: The Brief Writes a Whole Article and STILL Misses The Point!
item.description:
CLE RAMESH’S HOT TAKE

Sunday, January 11, 2026

[Uncle Ramesh on his verandah, Sunday paper in hand, reading The Brief’s Sunday edition, shaking his head so hard the neighbors looking]

Listen nah, it’s SUNDAY! Day of REST! Day of PEACE!

And this youngin’ at The Brief write the LONGEST article yet and STILL managing to miss every single point!

Let Uncle Ramesh break down where The Brief went wrong (AGAIN).

item.title: Sunday's Guyana Brief: The Mohameds Strike Back

item.title: Uncle Ramesh: The Brief Discovers Math But Still Can't Add!
item.description:
CLE RAMESH’S HOT TAKE

Saturday, January 10, 2026

[Uncle Ramesh reading Saturday’s Brief, calculator in hand, shaking his head at the math]

Listen nah, The Brief discovered MATH this weekend! They calculating 69,000 volts! They counting houses per day! They adding up murder rates!

Problem is: They still getting the CONCLUSIONS wrong!

Let Uncle Ramesh show this youngin’ how numbers ACTUALLY work.

Ã¢Å¡Â¡ 69,000 VOLTS: THE BRIEF FINALLY GOT ONE RIGHT

The Brief says: “Contractor almost killed himself”

item.title: Uncle Ramesh: So NOW The Brief Worries About Deportations? Where Was You Before?
item.description:
CLE RAMESH’S HOT TAKE

Friday, January 9, 2026

[Uncle Ramesh sipping his Friday coffee, reading The Brief’s “Storage Unit” headline, choking on his coffee]

STORAGE UNIT?! STORAGE UNIT?!

This youngin’ really called Guyana “America’s Storage Unit” and think he CLEVER?

Let Uncle Ramesh break down why The Brief got it HALF right and HALF wrong (as usual).

GE UNIT" - CUTE HEADLINE, WRONG TAKE

The Brief says: “Guyana volunteers as America’s storage unit”

item.title: Uncle Ramesh: This Youngin' Thinks Trump's a Hero? PLEASE!
item.description:
CLE RAMESH’S HOT TAKE

Thursday, January 8, 2026

[Uncle Ramesh reading THE GUYANA BRIEF on his iPad, coffee in hand, shaking his head so hard his reading glasses almost fall off]

Listen nah, I just read this youngin’s “Guyana Brief” and my blood pressure went UP.

This child writing like Trump is some kinda superhero! “Uber-kidnapped a president!” Like is a GOOD thing?!

Let Uncle Ramesh school you on what REALLY happening here.

item.title: THE GUYANA BRIEF: Thursday's Guyana News Circus
item.description:
E GUYANA BRIEF 1>

Your 5-Minute Guyana News Digest

Sponsored by: Strong Coffee & Questionable Life Choices

NG: MADURO GETS THE ULTIMATE SURPRISE PARTY

STATS:
Operation Speed: Faster than DoorDash
Caribbean Group Chat Status: Wild
Guyana's Official Response: Diplomatically Thrilled

Y’all, the Americans just Uber-kidnapped an entire president. Not even DoorDash is that efficient.
